query: Analyze ROAS drop in last 7 days

hypotheses.title: Creative Fatigue in Video Campaigns
hypotheses.description: Video creative performance has degraded significantly over the past 14 days, with CTR declining from 0.025 to 0.016 (35% drop). The same creative messages have been running continuously without refresh, leading to audience fatigue. This is most pronounced in retargeting audiences where users see the ads multiple times.
supporting_evidence: Same creative messages running for 20+ days
potential_causes: Ad frequency too high in retargeting
hypotheses.validation_approach: Compare CTR by creative age; test new creative variants

hypotheses.title: Platform-Specific Competitive Pressure
hypotheses.description: Facebook platform showing 28% ROAS decline while Instagram remains stable, suggesting increased competitive intensity on Facebook specifically. CPM on Facebook increased 32% week-over-week, indicating auction pressure from competitors.
supporting_evidence: Impression share declined on Facebook only
hypotheses.validation_approach: Monitor competitor activity; test budget reallocation to Instagram

hypotheses.title: Retargeting Audience Saturation
hypotheses.description: Retargeting audiences showing signs of exhaustion with frequency climbing to 4.2x while CTR decreases. Audience pool has not expanded in 10 days, suggesting insufficient top-of-funnel activity to refresh the retargeting pool.
hypotheses.validation_approach: Increase prospecting budget; reduce retargeting window from 30 to 14 days

supporting: Quantitative CTR decline matches hypothesis (35% drop)
Creative age correlation is statistically significant (r=-0.78)
Pattern consistent across all video campaigns

evaluations.reasoning: Strong quantitative evidence supports creative fatigue hypothesis. The 35% CTR decline over 14 days with same creative is a textbook fatigue pattern. Correlation with creative age (r=-0.78) is highly significant. Sample size of 487 ad sets provides statistical confidence. Effect magnitude qualifies as 'large' using Cohen's d standard. No contradicting evidence found.

supporting: CPM increase on Facebook (32%) indicates auction pressure
Timing aligns with typical Q1 budget allocation
Similar patterns observed in 2024 data for comparison
contradicting: Some campaign types on Facebook maintained performance

evaluations.reasoning: Platform-specific performance divergence is well-documented. Facebook ROAS decline of 28% versus Instagram's 2% decline strongly suggests platform-specific factors rather than systematic issues. CPM increase of 32% is a clear indicator of competitive pressure. Minor contradiction exists (some campaigns stable) but this could be explained by different targeting or creative quality. Confidence slightly reduced due to lack of direct competitor data.

supporting: Frequency increase (50%) correlates with CTR decrease (33%)
Audience size stagnation confirmed over 10-day period

evaluations.reasoning: Evidence supports audience saturation hypothesis with moderate confidence. Frequency and CTR relationship is inverse as expected (r=-0.65). Audience stagnation confirms the mechanism. However, missing data on exact audience sizes and configuration limits full validation. Sample size of 198 is adequate but lower than other hypotheses. Effect magnitude is medium. Status: partially_confirmed due to incomplete data access.

validated_insights: Video creative CTR declined 35% over 14 days, indicating creative fatigue (confidence: 85%)
Facebook platform ROAS dropped 28% while Instagram remained stable, suggesting platform-specific competitive pressure (confidence: 78%)
Retargeting audience performance degraded due to insufficient audience refresh, with frequency climbing to 4.2x (confidence: 72%)
requires_more_data: H3 could benefit from exact audience size metrics and retargeting window settings for full confirmation
